heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 1.7°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 7.6°C), dew point temperature (up 5.5°C), outside temperature (up 7.1°C), and cloud levels (up 582 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 251.7m lower than yesterday, 455.2m lower than the past week, 582.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 696m to a maximum of 1841m, averaging 1003.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1458.2m and 1585.1m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and winds will be practically absent. Showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and the light is absent. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (6.0°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
